Package com.irurueta.server.commons.image

Class ImageReaderResult

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.irurueta.server.commons.image.ImageReaderResult
  • public class ImageReaderResult
extends java.lang.Object
    Structure containing information about an image file that has been read using and ImageReader. This structure contains information such as image EXIF metadata, image format, file length, CRC, MD5, etc.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      MD5 hash value of image file.
      private ImageMetadata mMetadata
      Image metadata such as image size, and EXIF tags such as GPS location.
      private boolean mValid
      Indicates if a file contains a valid recognized image and is not corrupted.

        private java.lang.String mContentType
        MIME content type assigned to image file depending on detected image format (i.e. image/jpeg or image/png).

        Image metadata such as image size, and EXIF tags such as GPS location.

        private ImageFormat mImageFormat
        Detected image format. Supported formats are: JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP.

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Indicates if a file contains a valid recognized image and is not corrupted.
        Returns:
        true if file is valid, false otherwise.

      • setValid

        public void setValid​(boolean valid)
        Specifies if a file contains a valid recognized image and is not corrupted.
        Parameters:
        valid - true if file is valid, false otherwise.

      • getCrc

        public java.lang.Long getCrc()
        Returns CRC hash value of image file. CRC can be used to detect data corruption when sending data over a network.
        Returns:
        CRC hash value of image file.

      • setCrc

        public void setCrc​(java.lang.Long crc)
        Sets CRC hash value of image file. CRC can be used to detect data corruption when sending data over a network.
        Parameters:
        crc - CRC hash value of image file to be set.

      • getMd5

        public java.lang.String getMd5()
        Returns MD5 hash value of image file. MD5 hash value can be used to detect data corruption when sending data over a network. MD5 is more secure than CRC but its computation is also more expensive.
        Returns:
        MD5 hash value of image file.

      • setMd5

        public void setMd5​(java.lang.String md5)
        Sets MD5 hash value of image file. MD5 hash value can be used to detect data corruption when sending data over a network. MD5 is more secure than CRC but its computation is also more expensive.
        Parameters:
        md5 - MD5 hash value of image file to be set.

      • getFileLength

        public long getFileLength()
        Returns image file length in bytes.
        Returns:
        image file length in bytes.

      • setFileLength

        public void setFileLength​(long fileLength)
        Sets image file length in bytes.
        Parameters:
        fileLength - image file length in bytes.

      • getLastModified

        public long getLastModified()
        Returns timestamp when image file was last modified as the number of milliseconds passed since epoch time (January 1st, 1970).
        Returns:
        timestamp when image file was last modified.

      • setLastModified

        public void setLastModified​(long lastModified)
        Sets timestamp when image file was last modified as the number of milliseconds passed since epoch time (January 1st, 1970).
        Parameters:
        lastModified - timestamp when image file was last modified.

      • getContentType

        public java.lang.String getContentType()
        Returns MIME content type assigned to image file depending on detected image format (i.e. image/jpeg or image/png).
        Returns:
        MIME content type assigned to image.

      • setContentType

        public void setContentType​(java.lang.String contentType)
        Sets MIME content type to be assigned to image file depending on detected image format (i.e. image/jpeg or image/png).
        Parameters:
        contentType - MIME content type to be assigned to image.

      • getMetadata

        public ImageMetadata getMetadata()
